document.heading: Notarial Acts Clarification Amendment Act of 2024

To amend the Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts Act of 2018 to eliminate the requirement for a notary public to read and write in the language of any record on which the notary public performs a notarial act, require notarial officers to read or understand the language in which the notarial certificate is written, clarify that a notary may refuse to perform a notarial act if they cannot read or understand the language of the document being notarized or may require the signer to provide an official translation, and clarify that the training course for notary applicants must be approved but not provided by the Mayor.

history.summary: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced Bill 25-792 would eliminate the requirement for a notary public to read and write in the language of any record on which the notary public performs a notarial act. It also clarifies that the training course for notary applicants must be approved but not provided by the Mayor and also requires notarial officers to read and write in the same language as the notarial certificate executed by the officer.

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Notarial Acts Clarification Amendment Act of 2024".

section.text: The Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts Act of 2018, effective December 4, 2018 (D.C. Law 22-189; D.C. Official Code § 1-1231.01 et seq.), is amended as follows:

para.text: Section 4(b) (D.C. Official Code § 1-1231.03(b)) is amended as follows:
Paragraph (2) is amended by striking the phrase "; or" and inserting semicolon in its place.
Paragraph (3) is amended by striking the period and inserting the phrase "; or" in its place.
A new paragraph (4) to read as follows:
The notarial officer does not read or understand the language in which the certificate of notarial act is written.
Section 8 (D.C. Official Code § 1-1231.07) is amended by adding new paragraphs (a-1) and (a-2) to read as follows:
A notarial officer may refuse to perform a notarial act if the officer does not read or understand the language of the document being notarized.
A notarial officer may require a signer to provide a certified translation of the document being notarized.
Section 21(c) (D.C. Official Code § 1-1231.20(c)) is amended by striking the phrase "provided by the Mayor" and inserting the phrase "approved by the Mayor" in its place.

Section 22(b) (D.C. Official Code § 1-1231.21(b)) is amended by striking the phrase "notary publics and applicants for endorsement as electronic notaries" and inserting the phrase "notary publics" in its place.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement in the committee report as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the

Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto) and a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.02(c)(1)).
